faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about reporting safely

questions.a: Yes, absolutely. We use end-to-end encryption and do not store any identifying information unless you choose to provide it. You can submit reports completely anonymously.

questions.q: What kind of information should I report?
questions.a: Any workplace misconduct including but not limiting to fraud, safety violations, discrimination, harassment, environmental violations, or unethical practices. If you're unsure, you can always reach out for guidance.

questions.q: How long does the investigation process take?
questions.a: Investigation timelines vary depending on the complexity of the case. Typically, initial reviews happen within 48 hours, and full investigations can take 2-8 weeks. You'll receive updates throughout the process.

questions.q: Can I be retaliated against for reporting?
questions.a: Retaliation is illegal in most jurisdictions. We provide legal resources and support to protect whistleblowers. Our platform documents all communications to help build evidence if retaliation occurs.

questions.q: What happens after I submit a report?
questions.a: Your report is immediately encrypted and sent to our secure investigation team. You'll receive a unique case ID to track your report anonymously. Our team will review and may reach out for additional information if needed.

faq.supportText: Our support team is here to help you understand the process and your rights.
